description: From Middle English daysterre, from Old English dæġsteorra, equivalent to day +‎ star. Cognate with Scots daystern (“morningstar; daystar”).

entries.meaning: The morning star; the planet Venus.
examples: Here dawn'd the daystar of Hesperia's fame, / Here herald glory first emblazed her name;
I only go outdoors at night, away from the daystar's burning glare.
